column5: The Master’s degree in Chemical and Process Engineering programme trains professionals able to interpret, formalise and solve complex problems related to the design, operation and optimization of industrial processes where chemical, physical and biochemical transformations of material and energy are carried out. Focusing on process and equipment design and operation, raw materials selection, safety and environmental management as well as cross-disciplinary issues, the programme offers both strong theoretical and application-oriented courses fostering skills and knowledge for sustainable engineering deployment in future society. This is a European-accredited Master engineering program according to the EUR-ACE system.
column7: Our tuition fees will not exceed 2700 euros per year. Scholarship and fee waivers are available for international students, for more information visit our website.
